description: In the face of discrimination, inequality, and other forms of injustice, individuals and groups
have organized to resist such injustice, and to seek to change institutions, practices and society
attempts to address their grievances. This course will examine and explore some of the theories
and practices of social movement organizing from primarily a sociological perspective, through
in-depth studies of particular cases and comparative analysis of a range of contemporary and
recent movements. Prerequisite: One SOAN or other social science course.
